klass.name: Introduction to Computer Programming for Scientists...
klass.note: Engineering 77, 110, and Computer Science 3, 3L, 3S, 9ABCDEFG, are the current set of "computer service" courses. A maximum of 5 units may be earned toward graduation for these courses and students may enroll for additional units, but these units will be recognized only for the purpose of computing workload units on the study list. See the General Catalog for more information.

Technical Communication
klass.note: All students, both grad and undergrad, who intend to take 190 or for whom 190 is a requirement must take the Engineering 190 Placement Test. The test will be given 3 times each academic year: a week before Tele-BEARS begins in the fall semester, a week before Tele-BEARS begins in the spring semester, and the week before the fall semester begins. The test will not be given at any other time. The results of the test will be used to assign students to designated sections of Engineering 140 or 190. For the specific times and places of the test, please refer to the Program website at coe.berkeley.edu/ids/techcomm.
